Package com.example.webdisk

Class FilesController

java.lang.Object
com.example.webdisk.FilesController
@RestController @RequestMapping("/files") public class FilesController extends Object
The FilesController class handles HTTP requests related to file operations such as retrieving file size, fetching files, searching files, uploading new files, updating existing files, and deleting files. It uses a cache to store file metadata and a storage service to perform actual file operations.

The controller provides the following endpoints:

  • GET /files/{fileName} - Retrieves a file by its name.
  • HEAD /files/{fileName} - Check if a file exists, whitout getting its content.
  • POST /files/ - Uploads a new file.
  • PUT /files/{fileName} - Updates an existing file.
  • DELETE /files/{fileName} - Deletes a file by its name.
  • GET /files/search - Searches for files matching a given pattern.
  • GET /files/size - Returns the total number of files stored by the application.
  • GET /files/restricted - Demo endpoint for security implementation.

The controller uses the following dependencies:

  • FilesCache - A cache for storing file metadata.
  • FilesAccess - A service for performing file operations.
  • Logger - For logging operations and errors.

The controller initializes the cache with existing filenames from storage when the application starts.

  • Constructor Details

    • FilesController

      public FilesController(FilesCache cache, FilesAccess storage)
      Constructs a new FilesController with the specified cache and storage.
      Parameters:
      cache - the cache to be used by this controller
      storage - the storage to be used by this controller

  • Method Details

    • initialize

      @PostConstruct public void initialize()
      Initializes the FilesController after its construction by reading file names from the storage and adding them to the cache.

    • getFilesSize

      @GetMapping("/size") public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<FilesSizeResponse> getFilesSize(jakarta.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest request)
      Handles the HTTP GET request to obtain the size of storage in number of files.

      Returns the number of files encapsulated in a FilesSizeResponse object.

       curl -X GET http://localhost:8080/files/size -H "accept: application/json"
 
 {"size":7}
      Parameters:
      request - the HttpServletRequest object that contains the request the client has made to the servlet
      Returns:
      a ResponseEntity containing the FilesSizeResponse with the number of files

    • getFileForFileName

      @GetMapping("/{fileName}") public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<org.springframework.core.io.InputStreamResource> getFileForFileName(@PathVariable String fileName, jakarta.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest request)
      Handles HTTP GET and HEAD requests to retrieve a file by its name. 
       curl -O -X GET http://localhost:8080/files/one
      Parameters:
      fileName - the name of the file to retrieve
      request - the HttpServletRequest object containing the request details
      Returns:
      a ResponseEntity containing the file as an InputStreamResource if found, or a 404 Not Found status if the file does not exist in the cache, or a 500 Internal Server Error status if an error occurs while reading the file

    • postFile

      @PostMapping("/upload") public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<FilesPostFileResponse> postFile(@RequestParam org.springframework.web.multipart.MultipartFile file, jakarta.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest request)
      Handles the HTTP POST request to upload a new file. 
       curl -X POST -H "Content-Type: multipart/form-data" -F "file=@./oneup" http://localhost:8080/files/upload
 
 {"fileName":"C73SM6cuo_GxPRkOqzUIfMGvX-v5_FZ9bQWP_Vn3J"}
      Parameters:
      file - the file content to be uploaded
      request - the HTTP servlet request
      Returns:
      a ResponseEntity containing the response with the new file name

    • putFile

      @PutMapping("/{fileName}") public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<String> putFile(@PathVariable String fileName, @RequestParam org.springframework.web.multipart.MultipartFile file, jakarta.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest request)
      Handles the upload or update of a file. If the file already exists, its content will be replaced. 
       curl -X PUT -H "Content-Type: multipart/form-data" -F "file=@./oneup" http://localhost:8080/files/oneup
      Parameters:
      fileName - the name of the file to be uploaded or updated
      file - the content of the file to be uploaded
      request - the HTTP request object
      Returns:
      a ResponseEntity with the appropriate HTTP status code and message - 200 OK if the file is successfully uploaded or updated - 400 Bad Request if the filename is invalid - 500 Internal Server Error if an error occurs during the file operation

    • deleteFile

      @DeleteMapping("/{fileName}") public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<String> deleteFile(@PathVariable String fileName, jakarta.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest request)
      Deletes a file with the given file name. 
       curl -X DELETE http://localhost:8080/files/two
      Parameters:
      fileName - the name of the file to be deleted
      request - the HTTP request object
      Returns:
      a ResponseEntity with status 200 (OK) if the file was successfully deleted, status 404 (Not Found) if the file does not exist, or status 500 (Internal Server Error) if an error occurred during deletion

    • getFilesSearch

      @GetMapping("/search") public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<FilesSearchResponse> getFilesSearch(@RequestParam String pattern, jakarta.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest request)
      Handles GET requests to search for files matching a given pattern. This operation is not run async, given the nature of the cache. 
       curl -X GET http://localhost:8080/files/search?pattern=one
 
 {"results":["one","andone"]}
      Parameters:
      pattern - the search pattern to match files against
      request - the HttpServletRequest object containing the request details
      Returns:
      a ResponseEntity containing a FilesSearchResponse with the search results

    • getFilesRestricted

      @GetMapping("/restricted") public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<String> getFilesRestricted(jakarta.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest request)
      Handles GET requests to the /restricted endpoint. Demo endpoint for basic implementation of security, with preauthentication. For granting access, the presence of Authorization header is required, with a Bearer token of any value. Its validity with the authentication system is out of scope and was mocked. 
       curl -X GET http://localhost:8080/files/restricted -H "Authorization: Bearer any_token"
 
 Authorized
      Parameters:
      request - the HttpServletRequest object containing the request details
      Returns:
      a ResponseEntity with a message indicating authorization
